intro: Dianthera heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, often asymmetrical leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
